description: Tender meatballs filled with onions and Parmesan, bathed in plenty of tomato sauce, are classics in every way except for one: They call for turkey instead of the usual beef (or beef-veal-pork combination) Serve them over spaghetti or polenta, or stuff them into a hero roll for a sandwich Try to use ground dark meat turkey here if you can, it has a deeper, richer flavor than ground white meat.
title: Turkey Meatballs in Tomato Sauce
title_page: Turkey Meatballs in Tomato Sauce Recipe - NYT Cooking
text: Tender meatballs filled with onions and Parmesan, bathed in plenty of tomato sauce, are classics in every way except for one: They call for turkey instead of the usual beef (or beef-veal-pork combination). Serve them over spaghetti or polenta, or stuff them into a hero roll for a sandwich. Try to use ground dark meat turkey here if you can, it has a deeper, richer flavor than ground white meat.
